title: How to Insert Curly Brackets on an AZERTY Keyboard

steps.title: Go to System Preferences.
steps.content: Go to System Preferences. You can search for it in Spotlight or go through the Apple logo in the top left corner, then select System Preferences.

steps.title: Check Show Keyboard & Character Viewer in menu bar.
steps.content: Check Show Keyboard & Character Viewer in menu bar. A little box should now appear in the menu bar at the top right.

steps.title: Click the box, and select Show Character Viewer.
steps.content: Click the box, and select Show Character Viewer. In the Character Viewer you can select numerous characters. Select Parentheses on the left side, and you will be able to access the curly brackets.

steps.title: Combine the Alt⌥ key with the normal parentheses ().
steps.content: Combine the Alt⌥ key with the normal parentheses () . Hit the keys at the same time and you will get a curly bracket. Select Alt + ( to make " { ". Select Alt + ) to make " } ". And that's all there is to it! Enjoy knowing your way a bit more across an AZERTY keyboard.
